intro: Tomophyllum hornei, commonly known as the Horne's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. Tomophyllum hornei is often found in alpine meadows and is a characteristic species of the Andean flora.
